recipe_name: Pan-grilled chicken breasts with parsley salad and sun-dried tomatoes
author: Darina Allen
method: First make the basil dressing. Whiz the basil with the oil, vinegar, shallot, garlic and seasoning in a blender or food processor. Keep aside. Brush the chicken breast with olive oil and cook on a pre-heated grill pan until just cooked through. The chicken should be golden on both sides and criss-crossed with markings from the grill pan. Season. For the salad, toss the parsley in a little of the basil dressing, and sprinkle with a little Worcestershire sauce. Put a portion of parsley salad on each plate, sprinkle with a few pieces of sun-dried tomato and slivers of parmesan cheese.  Serve with rustic roast potatoes or buffalo chips.
